content.raw:
Sort of.

At some point on the `default` branch, the call to `ign_create_docs()` was moved from `ign_create_packages()` to `ign_configure_project()`, and so having this command here was causing cmake errors since `add_subdirectory(src)` was happening twice.

Now it seems that at some point since then on `default`, `ign_create_docs()` was moved back from `ign_configure_project()` to `ign_create_packages()` where it used to be.

Either that, or some very strange wires got crossed during a merge.
content.html:
Sort of.

At some point on the default branch, the call to ign_create_docs() was moved from ign_create_packages() to ign_configure_project(), and so having this command here was causing cmake errors since add_subdirectory(src) was happening twice.

Now it seems that at some point since then on default, ign_create_docs() was moved back from ign_configure_project() to ign_create_packages() where it used to be.

Either that, or some very strange wires got crossed during a merge.
